title: Grandma's Banana Bread
description: A handwritten recipe passed down from Grandma â€” four ripe bananas, a cup of chopped nuts, and an hour in the oven. The kind of banana bread that makes the whole house smell like home.
ingredients: 1 cup milk mixed with 2 tablespoons vinegar (buttermilk substitute)
3 cups flour, sifted with 1 teaspoon baking soda
steps: Preheat your oven to 350Â°F. Grease and flour two standard loaf pans.
Mash the bananas in a large bowl with a fork until mostly smooth â€” a few small chunks are fine.
Mix the milk and vinegar together in a small bowl or measuring cup and set it aside for a few minutes to curdle into a buttermilk substitute.
In a large mixing bowl, cream the softened butter and sugar together until combined.
Add the beaten eggs and mashed bananas to the butter-sugar mixture and stir until well mixed.
Sift the flour and baking soda together, then add to the wet ingredients alternately with the milk-vinegar mixture, stirring until just combined. Do not overmix.
Fold in the chopped walnuts. Or make it your own â€” skip the nuts entirely, swap in pecans, add a cup of chocolate chips, or mix in whatever sounds good to you. The batter handles it all.
Divide the batter evenly between the two prepared loaf pans.
Bake at 350Â°F for 1 hour, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Let the loaves cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely before slicing.
